channel.title: +Disease on Vishvas's notes
channel.description: Recent content in +Disease on Vishvas's notes

item.title: Acidity
item.description:
Antacids

H2 blockers

  • ranitidine
    • Zinetac

proton pump inhibitors

  • Prilosec

item.title: Cancer
item.description:
Intro

Sometimes, cells in an organism go rogue; they don’t listen to signals from other cells, and start reproducing and form a tumor; they hog the nutrient supply coming to that region. As they reproduce, they make inexact copies of themselves, and they fight with each other for the limited nutrient supply: the ‘survival of the fittest’ game is seen within the tumor, and repeatedly one type of cell comes to dominate others.

item.title: Diarrhoea
item.description:
Food

  • ORS (Oral rehydration solution) - powder mixed with water
    • Restores electrolytes.
  • Small portions of (nendra) banana-s (some cooked when unripe), yogurt fermented rice helped. Large portions led to diarrhoea.

Ayurvedic

  • kUTaja-ghanavATI - 1-2 tablets twice daily

Allopathic

  • Zinc - 20 milligrams per day for children older than six months or 10 mg per day in those younger than six months, for 10–14 days (6, 7).
    • found to reduce the duration and severity of diarrhoeal episodes and likelihood of subsequent infections for 2–3 months
    • effective regardless of the type of common zinc salt used (zinc sulphate, zinc acetate or zinc gluconate)
  • Loperamide
    • Eldoper
    • Ensures that food stays in the intestine longer, allowing for more water to be absorbed.
    • In adults and children 12 years of age and older, the usual dose is 4 mg (2 capsules) as a first dose, followed by 2 mg (1 capsule) after each unformed stool. The maximum dose is 16 mg/day.

item.title: Injury
item.description:
Intro

  • Brain injury considered elsewhere.

Joint damage

Knee

  • Jumper’s knee: Risk factors include being involved in athletics and being overweight.[1] It is particularly common in athletes who are involved in jumping sports such as basketball and volleyball.

item.title: Obesity
item.description:
Lifestyle and Environment

“Spurious twin studies which prove that obesity (for instance) is mostly genetic have a blind spot in that separated twins inhabit the same modern environment; they also don’t understand there is no contradiction in saying that a condition is genetically based and environmentally based.”

item.title: Skin
item.description:
Disease pics

Itch

Prevention

  • Keep junctions clean and dry.
  • Wear loose clothing.

Treatment

Removal of attention/ touch works best.
1% methol (coolness + warmth generator) 1% pramxoine HCl (topical anaesthetic) cream.
Fungal infection - eg. jock itch / tinea cruris - clotrimazole works.

item.title: ज्वरः
item.description:
तीव्रता

ज्वरः प्राणान्तकृद् यश्च
शीघ्रमिन्द्रियनाशनः।
सप्ताहाद् वा दशाहाद् वा
द्वादशाहात् तथैव च॥ सप्रलाप-भ्रम-श्वासस्
तीक्ष्णो हन्याज् ज्वरो नरम्। ज्वरः क्षीणस्य शूनस्य
गम्भीरो दैर्घरात्रिकः॥(चरकः)

चिकित्साक्रमः

तस्यां तस्याम् अवस्थायां
ज्वरितानां विचक्षणः।
ज्वर-क्रियाक्रमापेक्षी
कुर्यात् तत् तच् चिकित्सितम्।(चरकः)

आचारः

नवज्वरे दिवास्वप्न-
स्नानाऽभ्यङ्गाऽन्न-मैथुनम्। क्रोध-प्रवात-व्यायामान्
कषायांश्च विवर्जयेत्।।(चरकः)

लङ्घनं स्वेदनं कालो
यवाग्वस् तिक्तको रसः। पाचनान्य् अविपक्वानां
दोषाणां तरुणे ज्वरे।
तृष्यते सलिलं चोष्णं
दद्याद् वात-कफ-ज्वरे॥(चरकः)

लङ्घनेन क्षयं नीते
दोषे, सन्धुक्षिते ऽनले।
विज्वरत्वं लघुत्वं च
क्षुच् चैवास्योपजायते।
प्राणाविरोधिना चैनं
लङ्घनेनोपपादयेत्॥
